Posted By: Amature_Hero (7/16/2011 4:15:02 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ DfctvDtctv - That 2/2 body is precisely *why* this is far and away a better card than [Disentomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Disentomb) in almost every deck (that would run either of them). If they cancel it for the creature it'd recur, then they'd cancel a Disentomb as well, and if they cancel it for the 2/2 body...then that's probably a very good thing, because they just blew a counterspell on a 2/2.  
  
Disentomb, meanwhile, doesn't affect the board in any positive way on its own whether it resolves or not. This gets you a 2/2 to block or pick up an equipment and swing while you wait to recast your recurred guy, Disentomb doesn't. If you're in a pinch and just need a dude on the table, this can be used even for no recurred dude; Disentomb can't.
posts.html:
@ DfctvDtctv - That 2/2 body is precisely why this is far and away a better card than Disentomb in almost every deck (that would run either of them). If they cancel it for the creature it'd recur, then they'd cancel a Disentomb as well, and if they cancel it for the 2/2 body...then that's probably a very good thing, because they just blew a counterspell on a 2/2.

Disentomb, meanwhile, doesn't affect the board in any positive way on its own whether it resolves or not. This gets you a 2/2 to block or pick up an equipment and swing while you wait to recast your recurred guy, Disentomb doesn't. If you're in a pinch and just need a dude on the table, this can be used even for no recurred dude; Disentomb can't.

posts.post_content:
I really think this guy needs new art. It's not bad art, it's gotten its value and now I think it's time for something different.  
  
Not a bad card either. It's one of the many good cards for teaching players how to play.   
  
"This is one of several things the black does really well. Whole decks are built on using this kind of effect."

Posted By: JFM2796 (9/17/2011 3:01:01 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Gained the "How the hell did I pull one of these form every single M12 booster pack I opened" award.
  
I saw that as an omen an started putting together a zombie deck with this, [Cemetery Reaper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cemetery Reaper), [Call to the Grave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Call to the Grave) and the like.
  
Then Innistrad came out and I found [Ghoulraiser](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghoulraiser), which is better than this in zombie tribal (unless I also add one [heartless Summoning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=heartless Summoning) to the mix).
  
Either way I'm going to add one [Army of the Damned](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Army of the Damned) to it. AoTD is a really cool win condition, even if not the least bit practical.
posts.html:

Then Innistrad came out and I found Ghoulraiser, which is better than this in zombie tribal (unless I also add one heartless Summoning to the mix).
Either way I'm going to add one Army of the Damned to it. AoTD is a really cool win condition, even if not the least bit practical.

posts.post_content:
For game balance reasons I have never got it why the same single color (Black obviously) is best-equipped to put creatures in graveyard (by killing and otherwise) and also best-equipped with different kind of raise-dead effects.  
  
Wouldn't it make more sense to separate these between different colors? For instance Black would be best at killing and White at raising the killed. Opposing effects between opposing colors.  
  
Anyways 3/5.
posts.html:
For game balance reasons I have never got it why the same single color (Black obviously) is best-equipped to put creatures in graveyard (by killing and otherwise) and also best-equipped with different kind of raise-dead effects.

Wouldn't it make more sense to separate these between different colors? For instance Black would be best at killing and White at raising the killed. Opposing effects between opposing colors.

Anyways 3/5.
